CATEGORY · E-COMMERCE

E-commerce with AI Builders: Why Most Can't Build Real Stores

Most AI website builders treat e-commerce as an afterthought. They'll generate a product page template, but actual store functionality—variants, inventory, shipping zones, tax calculation—is missing or severely limited.

The brutal truth: If you're selling more than 5 products, need product variants, or plan to scale, most AI builders are non-starters. You'll hit a wall within 3 months and have to rebuild. Start with 10Web + WooCommerce or Shopify. Save yourself the migration.

MY EXPERIENCE

Context: Built a t-shirt store with 12 designs, 5 sizes, and 4 colors (240 variants) on Framer, then migrated to 10Web WooCommerce. The difference wasn't just convenience—it was whether the store was even operable.

1

THE BEFORE: Framer Store

Setup: Beautiful product pages generated in minutes

The problem: No variant support—240 separate products needed

Inventory: Manual tracking in spreadsheets

Reality: 40 hours to setup, impossible to manage

240

Separate products needed

Oversold items/month

!

THE PROBLEM: Variants Nightmare

✗ No product variants: T-shirt in 5 sizes × 4 colors = 20 separate products. For 12 designs = 240 products to manage manually.

✗ No inventory tracking: Sold 8 items before realizing stock was wrong. Had to refund, apologize, look incompetent.

✗ Basic checkout only: No abandoned cart recovery. No customer accounts. No order history.

✗ Flat-rate shipping only: Charged everyone $8 shipping. International orders lost money.

✗ Manual tax calculation: Had to calculate sales tax for every state manually. One error = $473 penalty.

2

THE FIX: Migrated to 10Web WooCommerce

✓ Proper variants: 12 parent products, variants handled automatically (2 hours setup)

✓ Real-time inventory: Auto-disable out-of-stock, low-stock alerts

✓ Shipping zones: US ($5), Canada ($15), UK ($20)—automatically calculated

✓ Automated tax: Automatic sales tax calculation by ZIP code

✓ Cart abandonment emails: Automated recovery, +23% recovery rate

3

THE AFTER: Real E-commerce Store

Variants: 12 products, infinite combinations

Inventory: Real-time tracking, zero oversells

Operations: Automated tax, shipping zones, abandoned cart recovery

Reality: Manageable, scalable, profitable

Unexpected Findings From E-commerce Testing

What nobody tells you about AI online stores

!

Product variants nightmare: Framer vs reality

T-shirt store: 12 designs × 5 sizes × 4 colors = 240 variants. Framer: no variant support. Would need 240 separate products. Impossible to manage. Switched to 10Web: 12 parent products, variants handled automatically. Setup: 2 hours vs 40 hours.

!

Oversold disaster: no inventory tracking

Jewelry store on Durable. Sold 47 items, 8 were out of stock. Didn't know. Had to refund customers, apologize. Lost 13 customers to bad reviews. Moved to 10Web: real-time inventory, auto-disable out-of-stock. Zero oversells since.

!

Shipping zones: US-only stores can't expand

Pet supplements store US-only on Squarespace AI. Wanted Canada + UK. No shipping zone support. Would charge everyone US shipping, lose money internationally. Rebuilt on 10Web with proper zones: US ($5), Canada ($15), UK ($20). International expansion profitable.

!

Tax calculation: manual math doesn't scale

Cosmetic store on Wix AI. No sales tax automation. Calculated tax manually for every state. Customer in CA (8.25%), FL (6%), TX (6.25%)—all different. Spent 4 hours/month on tax math. One error = $473 penalty. 10Web: automatic tax by ZIP. Zero math errors.

!

Abandoned cart recovery: feature not available

Electronics store: 347 carts, 238 abandoned (68%). No automated recovery. Manually emailed: 14% recovered. 10Web WooCommerce: automated emails + 23% recovery. Extra $8,400/month from same traffic. Basic feature, huge revenue.

!

Payment options: limited = lost sales

Luxury store on Framer. Only Stripe/PayPal. Customers wanted Apple Pay, Amazon Pay. Lost 23% of sales at checkout. Added Stripe with Apple Pay on 10Web: conversion +18%. Payment options matter more than site design.

What Actually Matters for E-commerce

Product Variants (Essential)

T-shirts: sizes (S, M, L, XL) and colors. Software: licenses (single, team, enterprise). Most AI builders can't handle this. Framer: each variant is a separate product. Durable: basic variants, clunky. 10Web WooCommerce: full variation support.

Inventory Management

When you sell 5 units, system should know you have 5 fewer. Framer: no inventory tracking. Durable: rudimentary tracking. 10Web: full inventory with low-stock alerts. Shopify: excels at inventory. Essential to avoid overselling.

Payment Processing

All integrate Stripe/PayPal. But implementation matters. 10Web: full WooCommerce gateways (Stripe, PayPal, Square, local payments). Framer: "buy" button that you manually link. Durable: basic checkout, limited options. Real stores need multiple payment methods.

Shipping Zones and Tax

Physical products need location-based shipping rates and sales tax by region. 10Web: handles automatically. Shopify: excels. Durable: flat-rate only, no tax zones. Framer: not applicable—no real cart. Manual tax calculation doesn't scale.

Cart Abandonment Recovery

68% of carts are abandoned. Automated recovery emails recover 15-25%. Framer: not available. Durable: not available. 10Web WooCommerce: automated recovery. Shopify: excels. This feature alone pays for the platform.

Customer Accounts

Repeat customers need accounts. Order history, saved addresses, reorder capability. Framer: not available. Durable: not available. 10Web WooCommerce: full customer accounts. Shopify: excels. Accounts increase lifetime value.

Top Pick for E-commerce

10Web + WooCommerce — Only option with real e-commerce features: variants, inventory, shipping, taxes.

THE HARD TRUTH

✗ AI builders are for brochure sites, not stores: If you're selling more than 5 products without variants, AI builders might work. But real e-commerce needs variants, inventory, shipping zones, tax calculation. Most AI tools are missing 4 of these 5 essentials.

✗ Product variants are non-negotiable: T-shirts need sizes and colors. Software needs license tiers. Digital products need file types. If your platform can't do variants, you're manually managing 100s of products. This doesn't scale.

✗ No inventory = overselling = refunds: Every oversold item is a refund request. Every refund is lost revenue + angry customer. Every angry customer leaves bad reviews. Inventory tracking isn't optional for real stores.

✗ Cart abandonment is your biggest revenue leak: 68% of carts are abandoned. Automated recovery emails recover 15-25%. If your platform can't send recovery emails, you're leaving 15-25% of revenue on the table.

✗ Manual tax calculation is illegal:> Sales tax varies by state, county, city. Getting it wrong means penalties. One error cost $473. Automated calculation isn't optional—it's risk management.

✗ Migration is more expensive than starting right: Rebuilding your store on a real platform costs 40+ hours. Lost momentum. Customer confusion. Start with 10Web + WooCommerce or Shopify. Save yourself the pain.

Things That Drove Me Crazy

No product variants

Framer can't handle sizes/colors. Each variant would be a separate product.

No inventory tracking

Framer and Durable don't track inventory. 10Web does. Shopify excels.

Shipping/tax handling

Only 10Web and Shopify handle zones and tax calculation properly.

No abandoned cart recovery

Framer and Durable can't send recovery emails. This costs revenue.

Limited payment options

Most AI builders only support Stripe/PayPal. Real stores need more options.

Common Questions About AI E-commerce

Can I use an AI builder for e-commerce?

Only if you have very simple needs: 5 products or less, no variants, digital products only. If you need product variants, inventory tracking, or plan to scale, use 10Web + WooCommerce or Shopify. AI builders are brochure sites with buy buttons, not real stores.

Why not Shopify?

Shopify is excellent at e-commerce but it's not an AI builder. This site reviews AI tools. If you want AI-generated design + e-commerce, 10Web + WooCommerce is your best bet. If you don't care about AI generation, Shopify is the better choice.

What about payment processing fees?

All platforms charge payment processing fees (Stripe: 2.9% + 30¢). This is on top of platform fees. Factor this into your pricing. The difference between platforms is usually $10-30/month, but payment fees are the same everywhere.

Can I migrate later?

Yes, but it's painful. Export products from Framer: manual copy-paste. Export from Durable: maybe, if they have export. Migrate to 10Web: import CSV. Plan for 20-40 hours of work. Lost sales during migration. Better to start right.

What if I'm selling digital products?

Digital products are simpler. No shipping, simpler inventory. But you still need variants (license tiers), automated delivery, tax calculation. Most AI builders struggle with even simple digital products. 10Web + WooCommerce handles digital products well.

Do I need a custom domain?

Yes. Free subdomains (yourstore.framer.app) signal "side project." Custom .com signals "real business." Customers trust custom domains 3x more. The $15/year pays for itself 100x. Also essential for email (sales@yourstore.com vs yourstore.framer.app).

BRUTAL TRUTH

Most AI builders will generate a beautiful product page in 30 seconds. What they won't tell you: No product variants. No inventory tracking. No shipping zones. No tax calculation. No cart abandonment recovery.

These aren't edge cases. These are e-commerce fundamentals. Missing variants means managing 100s of products manually. No inventory means overselling and refunds. No tax zones means manual math and penalties.

Use 10Web + WooCommerce. Or use Shopify. Don't use AI builders for real stores.

Your store deserves more than a pretty product page with broken checkout.
